articles.title: Match Report - Argentina 13 - 36 New Zealand
articles.description: New Zealand snatched South Africa's world No 1 ranking and placed one hand on the Rugby Championship trophy after subjecting Argentina to a second successive thrashing within a week in Brisbane on Saturday.
articles.content:

articles.title: All Blacks back on top of the world after win over Argentina
articles.description: South Africa, beaten 30-17 by Australia in the first match of Saturday's double-header, will need to defeat New Zealand twice and pile on the tries in their last two matches to earn bonus points to have any hope of stealing the silverware.
articles.content:
New Zealand snatched South Africa's world number one ranking and placed one hand on the Rugby Championship trophy after subjecting Argentina to a second successive thrashing within a week in Brisbane on Saturday.

articles.title: Argentina will buy 12 JF-17 blocks III fighters from Pakistan
articles.description: Argentina has officially allocated $664 million in its next year’s budget for the acquisitions of 12 JF-17 Block-III fighter jets from Pakistan.
articles.content:
Argentina will buy 12 JF-17 blocks III fighters from Pakistan
Argentina has officially allocated $664 million in its next year’s budget for the acquisitions of 12 JF-17 Block-III fighter jets from Pakistan.

articles.title: Argentina government deadlocked as uncertainty hangs over cabinet
articles.description: Argentina's government remained mired in uncertainty on Friday, with President Alberto Fernández yet to decide the fate of rebel ministers who tendered their resignations earlier in the week, sparking a political crisis.

articles.title: Rugby-Pumas must improve attack against All Blacks after successive shutouts: Ledesma
articles.description: Argentina have failed to score a point in their last two meetings with the All Blacks and coach Mario Ledesma wants his side to take better care of the ball when they attack the Rugby Championship leaders in Brisbane on Saturday.

articles.title: Argentine farmers start corn planting with record crop in sight
articles.description: By Maximilian HeathBUENOS AIRES, Sept 16 (Reuters) - Argentina's farmers have begun planting the first batches of 2021/22 corn this week, the Buenos Aires grains exchange said on Thursday, a predicted record harvest of 55 million tonnes due to expanded planting area at the expense of rival crop soy.Argentina is the second largest global exporter of corn and in the current

articles.title: Argentina budget targets 4% growth in 2022, assumes IMF deal
articles.description: Argentina's economy is predicted to grow 4% in 2022, while inflation is expected to hit 33%, according to a draft budget released just before midnight on Wednesday that lays out the embattled government's economic roadmap for next year.
